page.title: 07Rangemore Playing Field
page.content: Rangemore Playing Field is about{5 {acres}in size and was given to the village by the first{Lord Burton}at a time unknown. The original deeds have been lost. There is a{football pitch,}a{cricket {pitch,}a new{bowling green}and the {school playing area,}with a car park at the entrance to the field. 2 football teams, and a cricket team play regular matches with other teams in the area during the year on Saturdays or Sundays. The bowls team is newly formed but has already arranged matches. There are{2 Trustees}and a{Committee who organise maintenance of the field. No sheep or cattle are allowed, and no buildings apart from the{pavilion, which is soon to be replaced with a new, larger one so that meetings and other activities can be held there.
